thread.title: Business Leaders Skeptical of US-China Summit - Finance
thread.title_full: Business Leaders Skeptical of US-China Summit - Finance - CBN News - Christian News 24-7 - CBN.com

author: CBNNews.com
title: Business Leaders Skeptical of US-China Summit - Finance
text:
President Barack Obama will host a state dinner for Chinese President Xi Jinping at the White House this week.
The meeting comes as the Communist nation works to remake its sluggish economy and clean up its stifling air pollution.
China's president has spent much of the week in Washington state talking to clean energy firms about potential business relationships.
The administration says that when Xi visits the White House, President Barack Obama will be firm in his stand against China's cyber-attacks on the U.S.
But some American business leaders say the president needs to get tough with China on lots of issues.
Kevin L. Kearns is president of the United States Business and Industry Council.
"We can't go on indefinitely handing over slices of our economy and expect to remain a world power and expect to have the industrial base to support our military and the wealth to have a decent and fair economy at home," he warned.
The White House state dinner is Friday.
